data.text:
Treasury bills

Every week, an auction for treasury bills is conducted by the Bank of Mauritius.

Treasury bills are issued at a discount. This implies that they are sold for less than their face value.

The face value is paid to the investor at maturity.

Maturity range of 91 days to 1 year.

Treasury notes

Treasury notes are usually issued through the Bank of Mauritius primary auctions.

Interest is generally paid twice a year and the face value of the instrument is paid to the investor at maturity.

Maturity ranges between 1 year and 5 years.

Government bonds

Government bonds are usually issued through the Bank of Mauritius primary auctions.

Interest is generally paid twice a year and the face value of the instrument is paid to the investor at maturity.

Maturity ranges of 5 years and above.
